medical_history.chief_complaint: Bilateral groin pain for six months, with more pain in the right hip than the left.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began six months prior to presentation and have persisted without a history of trauma. Pain intensity is more pronounced in the right hip. There were no reported factors that aggravated or relieved the symptoms.
medical_history.past_medical_history: History of interstitial nephritis diagnosed five years ago, stable serum creatinine levels since diagnosis, and osteopenia diagnosed based on bone mineral densitometry. A history of drug and alcohol abuse more than twenty years ago, with no use since.
medical_history.social_history: Engages in strenuous exercise, previously an avid runner but limited to aerobic classes for the past five years due to the diagnosis of interstitial nephritis.
